sentences.en: An old man in shabby clothes came to the door.
sentences.cn: 一位衣衫褴褛的老人来到门前.

sentences.en: He looked unshaven, shabby, and down-and-out.
sentences.cn: 他看上去胡子拉碴、衣衫褴褛、穷困潦倒。

sentences.en: His clothes were old and shabby.
Hugh’s jacket was old and shabby.
I knew it was shabby of me, but I couldn't help feeling slightly disappointed.
sentences.cn: 我知道我不应该这么想，但我还是不禁觉得有点失望。

sentences.en: It was hard to say why the man deserved such shabby treatment.
sentences.cn: 真搞不懂为什么这个人就该受到如此不公正的待遇。

sentences.en: Selling their fans short in such a shabby way is not acceptable.
sentences.cn: 如此过分地怠慢他们的崇拜者令人无法接受。

sentences.en: She looked at his shabby clothes with distaste.
sentences.cn: 她有些厌恶地看着他那一身寒酸的衣服.

sentences.en: She was ashamed that she looked so shabby.
sentences.cn: 她因为自己衣衫褴褛而感到无地自容。

sentences.en: She wore shabby old jeans and a T-shirt.
sentences.cn: 她穿着一条破旧的牛仔裤和一件T恤衫。

sentences.en: The old house has grown shabby with age.
sentences.cn: 那座老房子因年代久远而变得破旧.

sentences.en: The old man is in shabby clothes all the year round.
sentences.cn: 那个老人整年衣衫褴褛.

sentences.en: The other house got old and shabby, and that cut into the value.
sentences.cn: 周围的房子都破旧不堪, 这使得他房子的价值降低了.

sentences.en: The taxi stopped in front of a shabby, third - rate hotel.
sentences.cn: 出租车在一家破旧的 三流 旅馆门口停下来.

sentences.en: You look rather shabby in those clothes.
sentences.cn: 你的衣着显得有点寒酸.
